messageBody:
On Fri, 19 Jan 2001, Kent Beck wrote:

> --- In junit@egroups.com, Joi Ellis <joi@a...> wrote:
> > I have a wish, too. When you change the public API, please
> > deprecate the old calls, don't just delete them. Please?
> >
> > I upgraded to Junit 3.3.1, then backed it out again because
> everything
> > I have calls now-missing LoadingTestRunners! I have a whole bunch
> of
> > stuff automated, and it all broke. :(
>
> We deprecate for one release, then delete all deprecated methods as
> the first act of the next release. We'll have to go to some kind of
> time-out-based deletion when we have more frequent releases.

Yes, I think that would be very helpful. If deprecation is too agressive,
one may as well not bother at all. I wouldn't expect deprecated stuff
to be deleted in a minor update, ie between 3.3 and 3.3.1. I assume
something in 3.2 would be deprecated in 3.3, and deleted in 3.4.
Or maybe even later, if the 3.3 release isn't widely announced or if 3.4
follows it too quickly.

So, if I download 3.3.0 first, it will provide warnings when I run tests
with it? Or will I have to study the docs and track down deprecated usages
manually?
